title: Loopback
historical_context: This issue of Phrack reflects the ongoing engagement of the hacker community with the zine, showcasing the evolution of discussions and interactions over the years.
target_audience: Hackers, phreakers, and enthusiasts of hacker culture.
short_summary: The article presents a collection of comments and interactions from readers of Phrack, showcasing the community's thoughts and humor regarding the zine and hacking culture.
summary:
In this edition of Phrack, the staff compiles a series of amusing and insightful comments from readers, reflecting the vibrant community surrounding the zine. The comments range from nostalgic reflections on the past issues of Phrack to humorous takes on hacking and technology. Readers express their surprise at the continued existence of Phrack and share their own experiences and projects related to hacking and coding. The tone is light-hearted, with the staff responding to each comment with wit and sarcasm, maintaining the zine's tradition of humor amidst serious topics.

The article serves not only as a snapshot of the community's engagement but also as a reminder of the enduring legacy of Phrack in hacker culture. It highlights the importance of community feedback and interaction, showcasing how the zine has remained relevant by fostering dialogue among its readers. This piece is a testament to the spirit of collaboration and creativity that defines the hacker ethos, making it a worthwhile read for anyone interested in the history and culture of hacking.
